title: We used Gemini to make a web app with stats from the I/O keynote.
description: Last week’s I/O keynote was packed with live demos, model news … and plenty of numbers reflecting the momentum and growth of our products. Since there was so much going …
excerpt: Last week’s I/O keynote was packed with live demos, model news … and plenty of numbers reflecting the momentum and growth of our products. Since there was so much going on, we wanted to try a fresh way to explore and understand some of these updates — so we asked Gemini for some help. We used Canvas (which also got some updates last week) to analyze the transcript from the keynote, pull out some impressive numbers and offer explanations of them. Then we made just a few tweaks to ensure accuracy and zhuzz it up.To see the results, check out this interactive web app — just click on each tile and reveal what that number means. There’s even a post-I/O item in there we think many of you will be interested in!
text: Last week’s I/O keynote was packed with live demos, model news … and plenty of numbers reflecting the momentum and growth of our products. Since there was so much going on, we wanted to try a fresh way to explore and understand some of these updates — so we asked Gemini for some help. We used Canvas (which also got some updates last week) to analyze the transcript from the keynote, pull out some impressive numbers and offer explanations of them. Then we made just a few tweaks to ensure accuracy and zhuzz it up.To see the results, check out this interactive web app — just click on each tile and reveal what that number means. There’s even a post-I/O item in there we think many of you will be interested in!
html:
Last week’s I/O keynote was packed with live demos, model news … and plenty of numbers reflecting the momentum and growth of our products. Since there was so much going on, we wanted to try a fresh way to explore and understand some of these updates — so we asked Gemini for some help. We used Canvas (which also got some updates last week) to analyze the transcript from the keynote, pull out some impressive numbers and offer explanations of them. Then we made just a few tweaks to ensure accuracy and zhuzz it up.

To see the results, check out this interactive web app — just click on each tile and reveal what that number means. There’s even a post-I/O item in there we think many of you will be interested in!
